intro: Centropogon cylindricus, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial with erect, cylindrical stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a spike, which are followed by rounded, inflated seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in disturbed or open habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family.
